item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Russell
item.description: "Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting." -- John Russell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Baz Luhrmann and Craig Pearce
item.description: "Don't be reckless with other people's hearts, And don't put up with people that are reckless with yours." -- Baz Luhrmann and Craig Pearce

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Patrick Jones
item.description: "There is eloquence in screaming." -- Patrick Jones

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Michael Levine
item.description: "Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist." -- Michael Levine

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Rachel add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Walter Bagehot
item.description: "The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do." -- Walter Bagehot

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Orben
item.description: "Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian." -- Robert Orben

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Kenneth Galbraith
item.description: "The only function of economic forecasting is to make astrology look respectable." -- John Kenneth Galbraith

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Rachel add a quote by C.P. Snow
item.description: "When you think of the long and gloomy history of man, you will find more hideous crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion." -- C.P. Snow

item.title: Rachel add a quote by H. Rider Haggard
item.description: "As I grow older, I regret to say that a detestable habit of thinking seems to be getting a hold of me." -- H. Rider Haggard

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Honesty may be the best policy, but it's important to remember that apparently, by elimination, dishonesty is the second-best policy." -- George Carlin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Al Franken
item.description: "When you encounter seemingly good advice that contradicts other seemingly good advice, ignore them both." -- Al Franken

item.title: Rachel add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Rachel add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Man is a clever animal who behaves like an imbecile." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alice James
item.description: "One has a greater sense of intellectual degradation after an interview with a doctor than from any human experience." -- Alice James

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Will Durant
item.description: "Education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance." -- Will Durant

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Frank Iero
item.description: "Homophobia is gay." -- Frank Iero
